timeline.bodyText:
If all of these have the same before_scripts can't we just do
python:
 -3.6
 -3.7
 -3.8
before_script:
script:
timeline.author: RussellSpitzer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -45,10 +45,28 @@ matrix:
         - $HOME/.gradle/wrapper/
 
   - language: python
-    python: 3.6
+    python:
+      - 3.6
     before_script:
       - cd python
       - pip install -e .[dev]
+      - pip install -U tox-travis
+    script: tox
+  - language: python
+    python:
+      - 3.7
+    before_script:
+      - cd python
+      - pip install -e .[dev]
+      - pip install -U tox-travis
+    script: tox
+  - language: python
+    python:
+      - 3.8

replies.bodyText:
I thought so as well. Travis seems to only run one python in that case.
Compare yesterdays travis run:
https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/iceberg/builds/720376892
To today's with the duplicate code removed:
https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/iceberg/builds/720565051
replies.author: rymurr

replies.bodyText: It looks fine with all 3 separate, but the 3.8 config lists both 3.6 and 3.7 as well. Should those be removed?
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Travis is a mystery sometimes :) I wouldn't waste time figuring it out since the current version works
replies.author: RussellSpitzer
